content:
• Tuesday, March 13, 2012
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q4 beats across the board on a 54% Y/Y jump in...

    More on Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q4 beats across the board on a 54% Y/Y jump in revenue. The company also boosts its FY12 guidance, now seeing an EPS of $0.76 - $0.81 on revenue of $268M - $274M. Street estimates are for $0.76 on $266M. Shares +5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM
  • GWRE

    More on Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 beats on all fronts on a 30% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net profits...

    More on Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 beats on all fronts on a 30% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net profits actually dropped 32% Y/Y, however, on a higher tax provision and increased operating expenses. Shares +10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • NORNQ

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR) -4.2% AH after announcing it will sell 10M shares held by Apollo...

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR) -4.2% AH after announcing it will sell 10M shares held by Apollo Management (NYSE:APO) in a public stock offering. The offering will bring the voting power of Apollo's stake in Noranda below 50%, thus ending Noranda's status as a "controlled company" according to NYSE listing standards.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN) resumes trading after a halt, -14.3% AH on disappointing Q4...

    Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN) resumes trading after a halt, -14.3% AH on disappointing Q4 results. The specialty retailer's Q4 loss of $0.19/share was better than expected, but revenues fell Y/Y and were below consensus. PSUN sees a Q1 loss of $0.34-$0.26/share, excluding non-recurring items, vs. a consensus $0.23 loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • C

    Citigroup (NYSE:C), one of four financial firms which fell short on the Fed's stress tests, says...

    Citigroup (NYSE:C), one of four financial firms which fell short on the Fed's stress tests, says it will submit a revised capital plan later this year. "The results [of the test] showed that Citi exceeded the stress test requirements without the capital actions Citi proposed. However, [the Fed] advised Citi that it objected to Citi's proposed return of capital to shareholders," Citi says.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) -4.3% AH due to the Fed's stress test results. The results (.pdf) had MetLife...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) -4.3% AH due to the Fed's stress test results. The results (.pdf) had MetLife posting a minimum tier 1 capital ratio of 5.1% through Q4 2013 in a stress scenario, as well as a minimum tier 1 leverage ratio of 3.4% - levels that lead the Fed to object to MetLife's capital distribution plan. MetLife has responded by saying it's "deeply disappointed" with the Fed's conclusions.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • C

    Citigroup (NYSE:C), SunTrust (NYSE:STI), and Ally Financial have failed the Fed's stress tests,...

    Citigroup (NYSE:C), SunTrust (NYSE:STI), and Ally Financial have failed the Fed's stress tests, which mandate a minimum tier 1 capital ratio of 5%. Citi had a projected 4.9% ratio under the tests, SunTrust a 4.8% ratio, and Ally a mere 2.5% ratio. C -3.7% AH. STI -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 16 Comments
  • STI

    SunTrust (NYSE:STI) -5.2% AH on news it was one of four financials (along with Citigroup, Ally...

    SunTrust (NYSE:STI) -5.2% AH on news it was one of four financials (along with Citigroup, Ally Financial, and MetLife) to fail the Fed's stress test. With a stressed ratio of 4.8% of Tier 1 common capital, STI fell below the Fed's 5% threshold against the proposed capital actions through Q4 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) +2.6% AH following its announcement of a 123% boost in its...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) +2.6% AH following its announcement of a 123% boost in its quarterly dividend and a capital allocation strategy that includes prioritizing all potential uses of future operating cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 2 Comments

  • BB&T (BBT +3.7%, +0.3% AH) boosts its quarterly dividend 25% to $0.20, with bank dividend...

    BB&T (BBT +3.7%, +0.3% AH) boosts its quarterly dividend 25% to $0.20, with bank dividend hikes now coming like a leaky bucket as Fed stress test results are a few minutes away.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) announces the public offering of 17M shares of its common stock...

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) announces the public offering of 17M shares of its common stock and says that it plans to use the proceeds to pay off indebtedness. Shares -4.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • FALC

    FalconStor Software (OTC:FALC): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $25.4M (-4.2% Y/Y)...

    FalconStor Software (OTC:FALC): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $25.4M (-4.2% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • MED

    Medifast (NYSE:MED): Q4 EPS of $0.08 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $69M (+10.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Medifast (NYSE:MED): Q4 EPS of $0.08 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $69M (+10.5% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $55.1M (+30.3% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $55.1M (+30.3% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC): Q4 EPS of -$0.52 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $2.6M (-25.7%...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC): Q4 EPS of -$0.52 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $2.6M (-25.7% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • TCF

    JP Morgan recommends taking advantage of today's strength in TCF Financial (TCB +6.4%) to take...

    JP Morgan recommends taking advantage of today's strength in TCF Financial (TCB +6.4%) to take some profit off the table over the next few days. The firm says much of the upside action has been due to a lot of short covering and notes fundamentals still remain under pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -1.4%) and Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -6%) tumble lower after a failed...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -1.4%) and Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -6%) tumble lower after a failed U.S. Senate vote to grant tax breaks to natural gas trucks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • BNHN

    Shares of Benihana (BNHN +2.7%) spike up after the company announces that it's exploring...

    Shares of Benihana (BNHN +2.7%) spike up after the company announces that it's exploring strategic options for itself, including a possible sale. Jefferies has been hired to assist the firm in the process.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • GLD

    Apparently gold has failed the Fed's stress test as the price dives over the past 30 minutes to...

    Apparently gold has failed the Fed's stress test as the price dives over the past 30 minutes to $1,667/oz. GLD -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • ULTA

    JP Morgan raises estimates and pounds the table on Ulta Salon (ULTA +1.1%), touting the stock as...

    JP Morgan raises estimates and pounds the table on Ulta Salon (ULTA +1.1%), touting the stock as its best idea for 2012 on the back of the company's solid Q4 result last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • JPM

    Other bank stocks react to JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) receiving Fed permission to return capital to...

    Other bank stocks react to JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) receiving Fed permission to return capital to shareholders: C +6.4%, BAC +4.6%, WFC +4.9%, MS +4.5%, GS +6.2%. Financials ETF: XLF +3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • OMER

    Shares of clinical-stage biopharma Omeros (OMER +33.2%) explode higher after announcing a Phase...

    Shares of clinical-stage biopharma Omeros (OMER +33.2%) explode higher after announcing a Phase 3 clinical trial showed its ophthalmology product, OMS302, helped keep pupils dilated in patients undergoing surgery to implant lenses in their eyes. Wedbush lifts its price target on the stock to $17 from $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • ZQK

    Investors have overreacted following Quiksilver's (ZQK +6.2%) weak FQ1 report last week, Janney...

    Investors have overreacted following Quiksilver's (ZQK +6.2%) weak FQ1 report last week, Janney says, and are focusing too much on "near-term headlines while missing the bigger picture" involving a re-acceleration starting in Q3. Asserting shares should be bought on the dip, the firm maintains its bullish stance on the outdoor sports outfitter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • JPM

    Markets move off the JPMorgan (JPM +5.8%) dividend bump, if not from the Fed's (in)action on...

    Markets move off the JPMorgan (JPM +5.8%) dividend bump, if not from the Fed's (in)action on policy. S&P 500 now +1.4% to 1,390, Nasdaq +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -0.1%) is said to be planning a secondary offering to avoid a lock-up sell-off. The...

    Zynga (ZNGA -0.1%) is said to be planning a secondary offering to avoid a lock-up sell-off. The company is trying to avoid what happened to LinkedIn (LNKD +3.5%), which saw its stock drop following the expiration of its lock-up period in November.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM

  • JPMorgan ([JPM) announces a 20% increase in its dividend payout to $0.30/share and a new $15B...

    JPMorgan ([JPM) announces a 20% increase in its dividend payout to $0.30/share and a new $15B share repurchase program that includes a total of $12B in buybacks that can be earmarked for 2012. Shares spiked off the news - up 4.8% for the day - sporting a new bumped-up yield of 2.80%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • BXS

    BancorpSouth (BXS +5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at SunTrust, saying the bank is a...

    BancorpSouth (BXS +5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at SunTrust, saying the bank is a takeover candidate, and will begin to show improvement in problem assets and loan growth in the second half of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • AAPL

    With ~$100B in cash on the books, CEO Tim Cook has said Apple's (AAPL +2.2%) board is studying...

    With ~$100B in cash on the books, CEO Tim Cook has said Apple's (AAPL +2.2%) board is studying what to do with the money. and Bernstein's Toni Sacconaghi offers a counter-intuitive idea: AAPL ought to bolster its potential payout by tapping the credit markets for $50B-$100B, with its low debt-to-capital ratio and premium bond rating, and given today's ultra-low rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +3.8%) shares are moving up on heavy volume after Pres. Obama, the EU and Japan...

    Molycorp (MCP +3.8%) shares are moving up on heavy volume after Pres. Obama, the EU and Japan ask the WTO to help increase China's exports of rare earths. But Dahlman Rose notes that given the massive drop in rare earth prices YTD, a negative WTO ruling may have no meaningful impact on prices. AVL +3.6%, REE +10.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHDN

    Shares of Churchill Downs (CHDN +9.9%) soar after the company smashes the estimates of analysts...

    Shares of Churchill Downs (CHDN +9.9%) soar after the company smashes the estimates of analysts with its Q4 report. Revenue grew 9% Y/Y to $149.3M during the quarter, boosted by a 37% jump in the firm's Gaming segment and another 18% for its Online segment.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.5%) sells off after Turntable.fm, an online music service that allows users to DJ...

    Pandora (P -2.5%) sells off after Turntable.fm, an online music service that allows users to DJ music and share their streams with friends, says it has struck licensing deals with all of the top music labels. There had been concerns that the studios wouldn't be willing to deal with Turntable, which has over 1M users.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • ETN

    Eaton (ETN +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy and $59 price target at Stifel Nicolaus, which cites...

    Eaton (ETN +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy and $59 price target at Stifel Nicolaus, which cites ETN's strong mix of early, mid- and late-cycle end markets. Even though growth rates in industrial, data center construction, and certain power quality markets are slowing, growth in industrial construction, aerospace, heavy truck and auto markets is accelerating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • MU

    Pacific Crest adds to Micron's (MU +3.9%) gains by raising its price target to $12 from $10, as...

    Pacific Crest adds to Micron's (MU +3.9%) gains by raising its price target to $12 from $10, as the firm believes that reduced DRAM capex will lead to higher DRAM prices. The firm maintains its Outperform rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • CCMP

    Cabot Microelectronics (CCMP +7.8%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy at Longbow, citing...

    Cabot Microelectronics (CCMP +7.8%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy at Longbow, citing improved margin expectations and numerous growth catylsts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • COL

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +1.4%) gets a boost from a price target raise to $52 from $48 at KeyBanc...

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +1.4%) gets a boost from a price target raise to $52 from $48 at KeyBanc earlier today. The increase is due to improved supplier furnished equipment revenues from its business jet segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • NLS

    Nautilus (NLS +9.1%) shares surge after Q4 results show better-than-expected EPS of $0.10 on...

    Nautilus (NLS +9.1%) shares surge after Q4 results show better-than-expected EPS of $0.10 on $60M in sales vs. breaking even in the year-ago period on $53.7M in sales. For FY 2011, the fitness products company returned to profitability as a 7% sales increase and decreased costs helped overturn losses; the outlook for 2012 is upbeat.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • INFN

    Shares of Infinera (INFN +2.8%) move up on high volume after the optical network provider draws...

    Shares of Infinera (INFN +2.8%) move up on high volume after the optical network provider draws notice from the German press as a possible takeover candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +3.5%) moves up on positive comments out of BMO Capital earlier today, saying the...

    TiVo (TIVO +3.5%) moves up on positive comments out of BMO Capital earlier today, saying the patent litigation claim construction issued by the court in its legal dispute against Verizon (VZ +0.2%) is identical to that issued for the DISH (DISH +0.5%) trial, and a positive for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN -5.5%) shares sink along with the apparel retailer's Q4 earnings and...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN -5.5%) shares sink along with the apparel retailer's Q4 earnings and margins, but analysts are split on what's ahead. Citi reiterates its Sell rating, doubting URBN can meet profit targets after a 700 basis point decline in 2011 operating margin. But Roth Capital maintains its Buy rating, calling URBN a “best of breed retailer.”

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • CVS

    CVS Caremark (CVS -1.3%) slips after BMO Capital downgraded the stock to Market Perform from...

    CVS Caremark (CVS -1.3%) slips after BMO Capital downgraded the stock to Market Perform from Outperform on valuation earlier this morning. Its price target remains at $47.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • CCIX

    Shares of Coleman Cable (CCIX -22.4%) are crushed after the electrical wire maker missed on Q4...

    Shares of Coleman Cable (CCIX -22.4%) are crushed after the electrical wire maker missed on Q4 earnings and forecast Q1 earnings below estimates. The company warns fluctuations in copper prices or in other raw materials such as petroleum-based compounds and transportation costs could impact profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSX

    CSX (CSX -0.5%) slips after Bernstein downgraded the shares to Underperform from Market Perform,...

    CSX (CSX -0.5%) slips after Bernstein downgraded the shares to Underperform from Market Perform, saying it expects the company's coal revenue to drop 13% in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (RAX +2.6%) is outperforming, and takeover speculation could be a reason why....

    Rackspace (RAX +2.6%) is outperforming, and takeover speculation could be a reason why. Rackspace, which currently trades at $54.38, is seeing heavy buying of April calls at strike prices of 60 and 65.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP +1.6%) gains after Bernstein upgrades the shares to Outperform from Market Perform...

    SAP (SAP +1.6%) gains after Bernstein upgrades the shares to Outperform from Market Perform earlier this morning, saying its HANA in-memory database is likely to be a disruptive technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • VCI

    Raymond James lowers its stock rating on Valassis Communications (VCI -3.1%), which provides...

    Raymond James lowers its stock rating on Valassis Communications (VCI -3.1%), which provides free-standing insert coupons, to Underperform from Market Perform, citing in part the accelerating shift toward digital media at the expense of paper-based media.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • BPZ

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +9.1%) trades higher a day after landing an upgrade from Rodman & Renshaw to...

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +9.1%) trades higher a day after landing an upgrade from Rodman & Renshaw to Market Outperform from Market Perform. Analysts arrive at a price target of $5.50 for shares by applying a 0.8X multiple to the NAV of the firm's reserves.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • LB

    Limited (LTD +1.3%) moves up after Argus raises its price target to $55 from $48. Argus notes...

    Limited (LTD +1.3%) moves up after Argus raises its price target to $55 from $48. Argus notes the apparel retailer reported higher than expected Q4 EPS and 12% comp growth at Victoria's Secret, and thinks the company remains well-positioned for further gains. It maintains its Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.1%) trades higher after providing a business update. Diamond, which has...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.1%) trades higher after providing a business update. Diamond, which has been crushed thanks to its accounting scandal, says its Emerald and Pop Secret brands gained share in the 12-week period ending Feb. 18, on the back of 29% and 6% Y/Y growth. The company also says it has retained a financial adviser to evaluate ways to strengthen its balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +3.6%) responds to Kazuo Okada's countersuit, saying it doesn't offer any...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +3.6%) responds to Kazuo Okada's countersuit, saying it doesn't offer any meaningful denial of allegations that he made inappropriate payments to public officials.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • MANT

    ManTech (MANT -3.8%) trades lower after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Underperform this morning,...

    ManTech (MANT -3.8%) trades lower after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Underperform this morning, citing intensifying price pressure and concerns over activity level. The firm lowers its price target range to $28 - $31 from $33 - $36.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • TCF

    TCF Financial (TCB +7.4%) says it has repositioned its balance sheet by prepaying $3.6B of...

    TCF Financial (TCB +7.4%) says it has repositioned its balance sheet by prepaying $3.6B of long-term debt and selling $1.9B of mortgage-backed securities, actions that will result in a sizable Q1 charge. The Minnesota bank expects the repositioning will increase net interest margin while also reducing interest rate risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands faces a $375M (LVS +2.3%) lawsuit in Macau related to how the firm landed the...

    Las Vegas Sands faces a $375M (LVS +2.3%) lawsuit in Macau related to how the firm landed the lucrative gambling license over 10 years ago that spurred it to develop properties on the Chinese territory. In a filing that might sound somewhat familiar to Steve Wynn, a former business partner of Sheldon Adelson accuses LVS of breach of contract in business dealings over the all-important license.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FDS

    Shares of FactSet Research (FDS +8.2%) spike following the company's solid FQ2 beat on earnings...

    Shares of FactSet Research (FDS +8.2%) spike following the company's solid FQ2 beat on earnings and revenues. On a client basis, the annual retention rate improved to 92% at the quarter's end vs. 90% a year ago, reflecting a reduction in client turnover. FDS issued in-line guidance for FQ3.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +2.6%) shares spike up and then pull back on conjecture regarding a well discovery...

    InterOil (IOC +2.6%) shares spike up and then pull back on conjecture regarding a well discovery in Papua New Guinea. A local publication report suggests IOC's Triceratops-2 well hit "elevated gas readings" upon approaching the reef top and could result in the company’s biggest discovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BAH

    Booz Allen (BAH -3.3%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing concerns...

    Booz Allen (BAH -3.3%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing concerns over slowing revenue growth and pricing pressure. The firm also lowers its target range to $16 - $18 from $18 - $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +4.4%) perks up as traders line up the company as a potential target for a...

    Dendreon (DNDN +4.4%) perks up as traders line up the company as a potential target for a takeover or passive investment with its valuation down a sharp 44% from just three weeks ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • GEOY

    Shares of GeoEye (GEOY +7.8%) rally after the company beats the EPS estimates of analysts with...

    Shares of GeoEye (GEOY +7.8%) rally after the company beats the EPS estimates of analysts with its Q4 report. The imagery services company says that its GeoEye-2 satellite program isn't a DOD casualty, as it remains on schedule and on budget

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD -1.7%) underperforms after Goldman's Greg Dunham slashes his rating...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD -1.7%) underperforms after Goldman's Greg Dunham slashes his rating to Neutral on valuation grounds. While expecting Cornerstone to continue growing due to its acquisitions and technology investments, and the early lead held by its cloud learning management offerings, Dunham considers Ariba (NASDAQ:ARBA) a better cloud play at current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.2%) brings in Cablevision exec Michael Husbey as it continues to...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.2%) brings in Cablevision exec Michael Husbey as it continues to contemplate its e-reader Nook business. Husbey oversaw two major spinoffs while at Cablevision and has the approval of Janney Capital Market's David Strasses for his track record of delivering shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • BBT

    BB&T (BBT +0.6%) agrees to take on the obligation of BankAtlantic’s (BBX +95.3%) $285M...

    BB&T (BBT +0.6%) agrees to take on the obligation of BankAtlantic’s (BBX +95.3%) $285M in trust-preferred securities to close the bank's takeover of the Florida lender following a judge’s recent ruling that blocked the deal because of the securities. BBT says its $301M deal for BBX has been made “even more compelling” by the improving economy in Florida.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN) +2.6% after receiving a positive IBD write-up. The paper notes...

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN) +2.6% after receiving a positive IBD write-up. The paper notes InvenSense's motion sensor chips have a 70% share within the Android phone market, and quotes an Oppenheimer analyst as stating the company has a 6-month technology lead over chief rival STM with regards to single-chip integration. The potential of InvenSense's new 6-axis motion sensor chips, which provide greater accuracy, is also mentioned.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • UTSI

    Shares of UTStarcom (NASDAQ:UTSI) soar 16% premarket after the global network solutions provider...

    Shares of UTStarcom (NASDAQ:UTSI) soar 16% premarket after the global network solutions provider turns to a profit in Q4 off of revenue of $83.5M (+9.6% Y/Y). The company says that it will continue to benefit from China's push toward triple network convergence.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • EBIX

    Shares of Ebix (NASDAQ:EBIX) post a 6.1% gain premarket after the company beats earnings...

    Shares of Ebix (NASDAQ:EBIX) post a 6.1% gain premarket after the company beats earnings estimates with its Q4 report and boosts its dividend by 25% to $0.05/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • CRTX

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRTX) +9.3% premarket after announcing that the FDA has...

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRTX) +9.3% premarket after announcing that the FDA has accepted a new drug application for CRTX 080, its product candidate for the treatment of hyponatremia.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • OMER

    Premarket gainers: OMER +31%. MDS +28%. WOLF +26%. UTSI +16%. TTM +3%.Losers: SB -10%. COOL -8%....

    Premarket gainers: OMER +31%. MDS +28%. WOLF +26%. UTSI +16%. TTM +3%.
    Losers: SB -10%. COOL -8%. YOKU -5%. URBN -4%. MWE -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
